page.title: 06TRAGEDY OF PRINCESS VICTORIA
page.content: "On the morning of 31st January 1953 the M.V. Princess Victoria left the East Pier, Stranraer, to make its normal crossing to Larne. Off Corsewall Point, the ship encountered the full fury of the gale which was that day to cause so much damage and loss of life throughout the country. Despite the valiant efforts of her crew, the lifeboatmen and other seafarers, The Princess Victoria foundered off the coast of Northern Ireland with the loss of 133 lives.Of these lost 23 were inhabitants of Stranraer whose death this community mourns."This is the inscription written on the plaque which is attached to a mound of granite stones, on which is mounted a huge bronze-coloured anchor.This is the memorial in Agnew Park to the tradgedy of the ferry Princess Victoria.
